div.l: At Trumpyngton̄ nat fer͗e from̄ Caumbrigge
There goth a broke / and oủere that a brigge
Vp on̄ the which broke ther͗e stant a myll
And this is v̉erray soth that I yoᵘ tell
A myller was there dwellyng many a day
As ony pecok / he was proude and gay
Pype he coude fyssh and nettes bete
And turne cuppes and wel wrastle and shete
Ay by his belt his belt a long panade
And a fyn̄ swerd full trenchant was þe blade
A ioly popper bare he in his pouche
There was no man for ꝑperill durst hym touche
A Sheffeld thwytell bare he in his hose
Round was his face / and camuse was his nose
As pilled as an ape was his skull
He was a market beter at the full
There durst no wight honde vp on̄ hīm legge
That he ne swore he shold anone abegge
A theef he was forsoth both of corn̄ and mele
And þat a slye / and vsant for to stele
His name was hoten̄ deynous Symkyn̄
A wyf he hade / com̄ of noble kyn̄
The ꝑperson̄ of the towne hir͗e fader was
Wᵗith hir he yaaf many a panne of bras
For that Symkyn̄ shold in his blode alye
She was fustered in a Nunrye
For Symkyn̄ nold no wyf as he seid
But she were wele norisshed and a maid
To save his astate of yomanrye
And she was proude / and pert as a pye
A full faire sight was it vp on̄ hem two
On̄ holy dayes byfore hir wold he go
Wᵗith his tippet wound about his hede
And she cam̄ after in a gyte of rede
And Symkyn̄ hade hosen̄ of þe same
There durst no wight clepe hir but dame
Was none so hardy þat went by þe waye
That wᵗith hir durst rage orels playe
But yf he wold be slayn̄ of Symkyn̄
Wᵗith panade knyf / or wᵗith boidekyn̄
For ielous folk ben̄ ꝑperlious eủermo
